paper.title: Determinants of regional differences in rates of overeducation in Europe
paper.abstract: This paper examines the factors determining variations in spatial rates of overeducation. A quantile regression model has been implemented on a sample of region-yearly data drawn from the EU Survey on Income and Living Conditions (EU-SILC) and several institutional and macroeconomic features captured from other data-sets. Potential determinants of overeducation rates include factors such as labour market risk, financial aid to university students, excess labour demand and institutional factors. We find significant effects both for labour market structural imbalances and institutional factors. The research supports the findings of micro based studies which have found that overeducation is consistent with an assignment interpretation of the labour market. (C) 2016 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究欧洲地区过度教育率的区域差异及其决定因素，使用了分位数回归模型分析劳动力市场风险等社会经济因素。虽然涉及回归分析技术，但研究内容与衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理等金融领域无直接关联。
